Package uno.anahata.asi.model.core

Class AbstractMessage

java.lang.Object
uno.anahata.asi.model.core.AbstractMessage
All Implemented Interfaces:
PropertyChangeSource
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractModelMessage, AbstractToolMessage, UserMessage
public abstract class AbstractMessage extends Object implements PropertyChangeSource
The abstract base class for all messages in a conversation, providing common metadata and functionality for the rich, hierarchical V2 domain model. It supports type-safe roles through its subclasses and ensures each message has a unique identity, timestamp, and full access to the chat context.
Author:
anahata-gemini-pro-2.5

  • Method Details

    • getRole

      public abstract Role getRole()
      Gets the role of the entity that created this message. This is implemented by subclasses to provide compile-time type safety.
      Returns:
      The role of the message creator.

    • getFrom

      public abstract String getFrom()
      Gets the identity of the sender of this message.
      Returns:
      The sender's identity (e.g., user name or model ID).

    • isPrunnableOrRemovable

      public boolean isPrunnableOrRemovable()
      Whether this message is prunnable
      Returns:

    • remove

      public void remove()
      Removes this message from the chat history.

    • setPruned

      public void setPruned(Boolean pruned)
      Sets the pruned state of this message and fires a property change event.
      Parameters:
      pruned - The new pruned state.

    • getDepth

      public int getDepth()
      Calculates the "depth" of this message, defined as its distance from the most recent message in the chat history. The head message has a depth of 0.
      Returns:
      The depth of the message, or -1 if not attached to a chat.

    • asText

      public String asText(boolean includePruned)
      Convenience method to get the message content as a single string, concatenating the text representation of all its parts.
      Parameters:
      includePruned - whether to include pruned parts
      Returns:
      The concatenated text content.

    • isPruned

      public Boolean isPruned()
      A simple getter for the EXPLICIT pruned state of this message. This is used by child parts to break the circular dependency in pruning logic.
      Returns:
      The explicit pruned state.

    • isEffectivelyPruned

      public boolean isEffectivelyPruned()
      Calculates the EFFECTIVE pruned state of this message. A message is effectively pruned if it was explicitly pruned OR if all of its constituent parts are effectively pruned.
      Returns:
      true if the message is effectively pruned.

    • isGarbageCollectable

      public boolean isGarbageCollectable()
      Determines if this message is eligible for "hard pruning" (permanent removal from history). A message is generally considered garbage if it has no parts and is not explicitly pinned.
      Returns:
      true if the message can be safely removed from history.

    • getParts

      public List<AbstractPart> getParts(boolean includePruned)
      The definitive, encapsulated method for retrieving the parts of a message that should be sent to the model, respecting the pruning policy.
      Parameters:
      includePruned - If true, all parts are returned, bypassing the pruning check.
      Returns:
      A new list of the visible parts.

    • getParts

      public List<AbstractPart> getParts()
      Gets an unmodifiable list of all parts in this message.
      Returns:
      The list of parts.

    • addPropertyChangeListener

      public void addPropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
      Adds a PropertyChangeListener to this message.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to add.

    • removePropertyChangeListener

      public void removePropertyChangeListener(PropertyChangeListener listener)
      Removes a PropertyChangeListener from this message.
      Parameters:
      listener - The listener to remove.

    • getPropertyChangeSupport

      public PropertyChangeSupport getPropertyChangeSupport()
      Gets the PropertyChangeSupport instance for this object.
      Specified by:
      getPropertyChangeSupport in interface PropertyChangeSource
      Returns:
      The PropertyChangeSupport.
